item.author: contact@example.org (FunWithData)
item.description: In mathematics, a curve (also called a curved line in older texts) is, generally speaking, an object similar to a line but that need not be straight. Thus, a curve is a generalization of a line, in that it may be curved.

item.author: contact@example.org (FunWithData)
item.description: General Principles of Performance Evaluation For Prediction - (prediction methods are used for generating numerical predictions) a) __ MAE__ (mean absolute error/deviation)= \frac{1}{n} sum_{i=1}^{n} | {e}_i | b) MAPE c) RMSE For Classification - (classification methods (“classifiers”) are used for generating propensities and, using a cutoff value on the propensities, we can generate predicted class memberships) Metrics Based on the Confusion Matrix a) Overall Accuracy b) Specificity and Sensitivity c) ROC curve A circle is a simple closed curve that divides the plane into two regions: an interior and an exterior.
